Reviews.Title: “Lady Diana Hotel - go there for the view!”
Reviews.Author: Urja K
Reviews.Content: The Lady Diana hotel is located a short 5-minutes walk from the tourist attractions of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Situated in the Sultanahmet district of the Old City on the European side means that the neighbourhood of the hotel consists of narrow, cobblestone roads, lots of tiny groceries, restaurants, bakeries and sweet-shops, all off set by the very modern trams which glide by silently. Very picturesque! The view from the 6th-floor breakfast room is absolutely stunning. Picture-perfect composition of the Blue Mosque overlooking the Bosphorous. From the outdoor terrace outside the restaurant, one gets views of both the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Wonderful! And the breakfast spread is more than generous and very tasty. The rooms are tiny, with no views as such, but there's free Wifi. All in all, a good choice given the amazing location and the amenities on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely adequate in SultanAhmet”
Reviews.Author: king238
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group. Location in SultanAhmet is great. View from rooftop restaurant is very good. Rooms are small and dated. My wife said, "That bed has been here since Constantine!" Would stay here again if I had to, but will try to find something more updated if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy rooms, unhelpful staff, expensive”
Reviews.Author: traveltravel001
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have stayed here twice cause location is great and views of mosques from rooftop breakfast are amazing. Rooms are small, smelly and strangely arranged. Some sre far nicer than others, yet cost thr same. Staff is consistently unhelpful, we laughed about this on this visit cause they were just as bad as the first time yet we come back. Well, not next year. We are done.

Reviews.Title: “poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Irfan A
Reviews.Content: rooms were so small couldnt open my suitcases comfortably, complained to reception said could do nothng about it. The only thing I like was the location and the breakfast was OK. The manager (Shaban) is less than helpful, the staff really do hate their jobs. Worst expereince of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the city ceter.”
Reviews.Author: davidiacus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to all historical sutes, everything is within walking distance. Easily accessible on foot to such famous places as the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art, Beyazit Meydani and Hipodrom. People working at the front desk are very nice, but I do not speak the best English. My first room was very cold and drafty.I asked for a new room. We were given a new room right away. Most wonderful thing is to have a breakfast on top if the hotel with the breathtaking panorama. Breakfast was very good, included hot dishes, all kind of cheese and fruits. We Thought That Was a great value! I am generally happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lady Diana hotel, Istanbul Trip”
Reviews.Author: lionelp
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in the Lady Diana hotel during my last business trip. The hotel is very well located, in the old city and 5 minutes by foot from a shopping area. Rooms are simple, but comfortable, clean and spacious. Wifi is free of charge in all rooms. The hotel manager told me that they are going to renovate the rooms this year. Staff is very friendly and professionnal. The restaurant view is incredible, on the Marmara sea. Continental breakfast is also nice, but simple. It can be easily improve (more choice for... Breads, eggs, fresh juices...) What is missing, in my opinion: Trendy music in the lobby, a nicer and bigger fitness center an maybe a terrace pool for summer season...

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: I'v stayed here for a night and I was imoressed by hospitalityof the stuff. The view is amazing, rooms are clean, the breakfast was good. there is nothing more to wish for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not reccomend this place.”
Reviews.Author: irfan a
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was OK however, one morning recieved a call from reception requesting me to come down, they wanted to charge me 50 lira for 2 small hand towles which had been stained by food. The shower was cold and they are not accomodating when it comes to requesting to move (we had a very noisy family next door who would not sleep untill the early hours). Not satisfied with the breakfast - if you like cold boiled eggs and stale bread then you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel , great staff , tremendous roof views and location”
Reviews.Author: larkenRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the small side and right off the Hippodrome near the Blue mosque. The rooms are small and basic, bath is very small but we did not spend a lot of time in the room so it wasn't an issue. The view from the roof at sunrise and sunset is amazing! It encompasses the blue mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus. The waiters were very efficient at the roof top restaurant and the food was fresh and excellent. The breakfast buffet included a great selection of hot and cold items, fruits, pastries and breads. We were able to walk everywhere but were also close to public transportation had we wanted to use it. The people at the front desk were also very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Oh what a view!”
Reviews.Author: Daria D
Reviews.Content: We checked in to this hotel for 4 nights. The front desk clerk casually mentioned that the view was good from the terrace, and showed us to our room. It was small, in a typically European way, but clean. And then we went to the terrace. Oh my. The Blue Mosue not more than 200 m distant,wth the Sea of Marmara and the Hagia Sophia right there in front of our faces. You can walk to every important sight from this hotel. The staff was friendly, the included breakfast very good and the food in the restaurant (with that million dollar view) excellent. I'd recommend this to anyone. We sure had a great time and the staff answered every question and gave excellent directions.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever should be 2 stars not 4”
Reviews.Author: mancunain
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel. Once the hotel has you money they don't want to know you. Our room was not available despite booking over 2 weeks earlier. After two hour wait offered us two sub-standard rooms on two different floors. The rooms were dark and very small. The air conditioning did not work despite the "handyman" trying to fix it three times. The manager is less than helpful, the staff really do hate their jobs. Worst expereince of my life - checked out after first night. Manager was rude and refused to refund money.

Reviews.Title: “Again it's all about location”
Reviews.Author: Onthegogirl_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick stay in Istanbul, our first visit. The hotel staff was welcoming and friendly. The hotel is within a short walk from the Sultan Ahmet Mosque (the Blue Mosque), the Hagia Sophia, the To[kapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. It is close to the tram line and is surrounded by cafe's and shopping. The hotel has a bar and restaurant on the roof that offers a panoramic view of the old walled city, the Blue Mosque, the Haria Sophia and the Bosphorus. and the Marmara. It is a perfect place for a cocktail in the evening. The food in the restaurant is tasty, the menu varied and the staff great. The hotel also offers a Turkish Bath, sauna, massage and fitness center but I didn't use these facilities, Our room was comfortable enough but definitely not plush. It was clean and neat. The bath was small but did have a sitting tub and shower. There was a mini bar which was reasonably priced. The elevators are very small. At most four smallish people or a couple with luggage is a tight squeeze. I would stay here again mainly because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eibrahim
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice and comfortable hotel but it is nothing super luxurious or anything like that. It is more like a 3 star than a 4 star. But it is clean, convenient and in an excellent location. We were able to walk everywhere within 5 minutes. If you are looking for night life, I don't think this is the right area. But for sightseeing, easy access by foot to restaurants, hagia sofia, blue mosque, bazar and so on, this is a fantastic location. In short, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: It is a typical hotel of the old city. The rooms are small and our room smelled humidity. The breakfast is poor, but it has a very nice view. The parking and the wifi is free. The reseption is not very helpful, they want to sell things to you from maps to suvenirs. If you ask for directions of a place, the answer is "I will call a taxi to get you there".

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: WendyS58
Reviews.Content: The Lady Diana is a mid-priced hotel in Istanbul in the old part. It is very pretty from the outside, but the rooms are dingy, tiny and depressing. I booked for one person for two nights--there were 2 single beds pushed together and no room to get around. Outside the window was a view of the wall. The air conditioning was broken and I was sweating all night. And this is 100 Euros per night! The bathroom is tiny, the hallways are dingy and dark--no lights. The one good thing was the breakfast buffet in the morning--fantastic! Beautiful views of the city from the rooftop terrace and serve yourself coffee so you can have as much as you want. The English of the hotel staff is very poor, however. The restaurant food is iffy. One night i had lamb chops and they were terrible--full of fat and gristle. Another night they were great. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, good value, nice room, good food, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: queenzelda1959
Reviews.Content: Best area to stay in, as it is close to everything old in Istanbul. The staff is knowledgeable, welcoming. The room was spacious and they offered to show us a few choices when we arrived. The view from the restaurant on the top floor is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “central location with fantastic views from the restaurant - a jewel in the back streets”
Reviews.Author: mishka762
Reviews.Content: Lady Diana Hotel was spotlessly clean and very well furnished, the staff were very friendly and made up for our lack of turkish with their faultless english. Our room was very well appointed and even twin beds added to the stay as it felt like sleeping on a cloud. Fantastic power shower with all the amenities, including disposable slippers with the hotel name printed on them. A well stocked mini bar and plenty of storage space. The rooftop dining is worth it even if you are bed and breakfast as we were, a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque and out over the rooftops to the Bosphorus, makes any meal an experience. The breakfast buffet was extensive and the food excellent, it goes without saying the coffee is gorgeous. We had an evening meal in the same restaurant and the floodlit Istanbul is just as magical. Its location is within easy walking distance of the tram stops and local attractions, the underground cistern was worth a visit even if you are not a James Bond fan. Hotel staff were happy to book local visits and we went to an evening at the Galata Tower. It is very well situated for travelling by tram from the airport, has a turkish bath in the basement and relaxing space in the huge reception area to have a drink and rest after all the attractions available to anyone visiting Istanbul. I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EPAMPS
Reviews.Content: I will very much recommend Lady Diana Hotel. It is a "typical" smaller 4 star hotel with excellent service, nice rooms (somewhat small but clean, a safe for valuables, free internet and wireless/wifi), but the outstanding benefit is location - (very)short walking distance to all major sights in the Sultanameh area (Hagia Sofia, the blue mosque, TopKapi, bazaar and spice bazaar, etc). Furthermore - the rooftop terrace is just great - overlooking the mosques, and with a very decent breakfast buffet. We would not think of choosing another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disinterested”
Reviews.Author: curryone
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at least six months ahead of our visit,on arrival we were told they were full for that day,we had to stay in an inferior hotel for one night of our four night stay. Being told it was no problem by the reception staff doesnt help,they were unhelpful to the point of being rude. There is a nice bar downstairs in the reception area but if you want a drink at night you are sent upstairs to the breakfast room to sit at tables in brightly lit surroundings smelling of cooking. The dining room was ready for the morning, nice terrace here but to cold at night in May to sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and food, reception staff need customer service trg”
Reviews.Author: MemTrav
Reviews.Content: I agree with the May 10 reviewer from the UK about the facilities, room, location, etc. I was impressed with the cleanliness and modern look of the room. I was in an outside-facing one, so no problems with size or heat (though will confirm A/C wasn't turned on yet). The food was actually quite good for a hotel. Of course, the food in general in Turkey was excellent! Especially loved the breakfast spread (best we encountered in Turkey) and the chicken shish kebabs. Most of the staff were quite professional and nice. There was, however, one reception person who nearly spoiled our stay. He was the rudest person we met in all of Turkey. He desperately needs customer service training (or dismissal). He was so negative and disinterested in helping us. So opposite to any other hotel person we encountered throughout the 4 hotels we stayed in during our trip. He singlehandedly made our final night in Turkey less than pleasant and has made me downgrade the rating for this property. Unfortunately, it doesn't appear from the other reviews that management ever read or respond to the reviews on this site. Please see my review for the Daphne Hotel (incidentally, their sister hotel) for my recommended property in Istanbul and just around the corner from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel stay with no major problems...”
Reviews.Author: nazrana82
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was a bit warm during the day but we weren't in the hotel during the day much anyway... Room was spacious, clean, modern, cozy. Rooms don't come with a kettle unless you're in a suite room (a bit strange- In the UK cheapest of hotel will at least have a kettle on your room!) Staff were polite and helpful. Buffet breakfast was fantastic with fantastic "to die for" views from the rooftop restaurant. good value for money. Last but not least SUPERB location...5-10 minutes walk from the grand bazaar, aya sofya, Sultanahmet mosque, topkapi palace etc Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable 28 degree centigrade room temperature, but great view from roof.”
Reviews.Author: HenryAUS
Reviews.Content: I had read many negative reviews of this hotel on trip-advisor, but despite that you can only form your own opinion once you have stayed there. I and several work colleagues stayed here for 2 nights. Let me start with the positives. The staff were helpful but there was some confusion about bookings when we checked in. It was eventually sorted out and not a problem. Our rooms were very small for 2 people, but one of my Turkish speaking colleagues got upgraded to a suit when he complained. He was very fortunate. A very good breakfast is served upstairs in their dining room. The Hotel enjoys a fantastic view from the rooftop restaurant. Now for my complaint. The first night our room temperature was 28 C. Unbelievably hot!. The air-conditioning made no difference. Open your window I hear you say. Well unfortunately the window opened to a small internal space between the walls, and that was covered with a clear roof. It was the same temperature. The corridor was cooler and we left our room door open until we went to bed in an attempt to cool the room. That worked for a bit, but when we closed the door to sleep, the temperature crept back to 28. Next morning we saw reception to try and improve our second night's stay. We were told to pack our bags and leave them in the room, and we would be relocated to an outside facing room whilst we explored Istanbul. Not surprisingly I bumped into another colleague who had also just successfully arranged a room swap. (But they later wanted to charge him extra) The staff explanation for the high temperature was that their heating system was still on, and they had not changed over to their cooling system yet. We returned late in the day to be surprised by the news that we were still in the same room. They did not have any alternate rooms available. "But you have fun now" the reception person told me. I was confused for a second. We did not have fun last night. Ahhhh, we have a 'fan' now, hopefully we can get a better night's sleep. Unfortunately it was noisy and we could not sleep any better with it on. Another hot restless night ensued. Again 28 degrees, which was measured from my accurate travel alarm. I kept checking it all through the long night hoping for changes, Well you can probably guess that as a result of this, that I will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never do the Mistake”
Reviews.Author: SAKader
Reviews.Content: I was totally disappointed with the Staff of the Hotel They never responded to my email. Staff was not friendly at all. I stayed for 4 nights and it was quite shocking for me to see that they took the money for all 4 days upon Check-in. Room quality was not upto the good. With the rate I paid I could have got room by the Sultanhamed Tramway. Please only stay in this hotel if you have no other options. Internet was very poor quality for the first 2 days and was then later it got better.

Reviews.Title: “Beware scam”
Reviews.Author: Love2Trave1
Reviews.Content: We reserved over the internet 2 months before our trip, but when we arrived, they told us they had no rooms left and instead would put us in another hotel. The other hotel was much lower quality and less expensive, but they did would not refund any of our money. Please don't make the same mistake of booking the "Lady Diana Hotel" and get scammed like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Not welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul_201112
Reviews.Content: The location is great - with an excellent view from the restaurant. But the hotel room is really small (wee could not even lay a suitcase open) but clean. The breakfast is just ok - nothing special. The reception and the managers attitude was not welcoming! And we had bad experience with email communication with the hotel staff (no response after several requests!). It is certainly possible to find better service at similar hotels, so we will definitely not stay at Lady Diana Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, off busy streets and great roof top views”
Reviews.Author: MarchingAnts
Reviews.Content: The excellent location is the best feature of this hotel. It's within five minutes walk to the popular tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hipodrom and German Foundation. Close to public transportation. The hotel is a bit off the main traffic road, so it's quieter than the ones on the main roads. The rooftop offers a nice view of the Blue Mosque. Breakfast is good. There is a large selection and they have hot foods as well. The rooms are small. If you're used to large hotel rooms, the tiny room might disappoint you. Beds were comfortable enough. The bathroom is small but suitable for its purpose. The bathroom doesn't give an impression of being clean. If you review my photos, you'll see there is some mold in the corners and tile, but I am guessing it's because it's so humid since its close to the sea. Housekeeping needs to be more aggressive about the humidity issue and tackle the trouble spots more. The walls are thin in the bathrooms and we can hear the occupant next door gurgling and doing his bathroom stuff. They have three computers in a room off the lobby for guest to access the internet. By the way, keep in mind there is a prayer call at around 5:30 am in the morning, but this is the culture of Istanbul. It might wake you up if you sleep light. It'll be heard from all the hotels in the surrounding area. Overall, I had a pleasant stay, and I would recommend this hotel to travelers that are not perfectionists

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: raja69
Reviews.Content: excellent service very beautiful views on balcoy .the buffet breakfast was very lovely also the main attractions eg; blue mosque,topaki palace, ahya shopia all at walking distance. the room was very clean and well maintained staff very helpful and cooperative

Reviews.Title: “A great location for your trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: viktoria40
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about this hotel as the reviews didn't seem great but couldn't have been happier. The location is excellent The Blue Mosque is about 100mt away down a short street. It is a quiet area and walking to all of Sultanahmet is very easy. This old town area really is the best place to stay in Istanbul. Close to attractions and great dining. We had a triple room which was a little on the small side and the bathroom is small but it is very typical of European style hotels. The roof restaurant and terrace have fantastic views over the mosque and the breakfast buffet was huge and the food a great variety. Would love to be here in warmer weather to sit at the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Ladymitzi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located right in the heart of Sultanahmet. The view from the Breakfast room is overwhelmingly beautiful, the room was spotlessly clean, breakfast was excellent and staff was very helpful and friendly. The bathroom was very small but very clean. It was about a two minute walk to all the bars and restaurants. All in all a great experience and highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Bad Reception Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Salman_Karachi
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel almost three weeks in advance through American Express and had paid in full but when we arrived, we were told by the reception that they were over booked and so they will have to shift us to a nearby hotel. We strongly refused saying we were confirmed a booking and we had also paid full advance but they were adamant and insisted that either we shift or else take our money back. We rang up our home country AMEX who told us that they CANNOT do this and asked us to provide name of the person who is refusing. On hearing this the reception people said "they are trying to look into it" and finally gave us the room as if they had done us a huge favour. POOR BUSINESS PRACTICE. We don't know if this is the hotel's policy or were the reception people doing on their own? Such practices create a bad impression about otherwise a decent hotel. The Wi-Fi signals were very weak in the room and we had to walk down to a place to use it which was irritating, though they advertise "Free Wi-Fi in room" We travel a lot but this attitude is rare.

Reviews.Title: “If the price is right - book it”
Reviews.Author: Bunny-Man
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy the Lady Di. Yes the rooms are not large, but clean. The bathroom is very small, but usable. The aircon is variable, especially after two days of playing with it, to be eventually advised that there is only heat available when we were there, but if you opened the windows, and stuck some ear-plugs in, was acceptable. Against these cons the pro's more than made up for it. Great location, 100 yards to the Hippodrome, and other areas of interest. Helpful staff, great rooftop restaurant for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late evening drinks. If the price is right (Â£100 for two B&B through Expedia) come on down.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: theblackhand
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated indeed for the sights, about 5 mins form the Blue Mosque, a bit further from Aya Sofia. It's about 3 mins from the Sultanahment tram stop. It's clean and cmfortable, although it lacks any particular character. Breakfast is taken in the rooftop restaurant with great views, which doubles as a bar in the evenings (as well as a restaurant that we didn't try); there's an outside terrace, but it was a bit chilly for that. Brekkie was good, full Turkish; yogurt, honey, cold meat, good range of olives and cheeses, toms, cuc, bread, jam, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, fruit 'juices', pretty good. The staff were pleasant and friendly; we made few demands on them, but they seemed helpful. the hotel has a hammam; we didn't get around to trying it. The Sultanahmet area is a great base for sightseeing, but not so good for eating; the grub is much better over the Golden Horn, in Taksim, and over the Bosforus. There are OK places in Sultanahmet, though; Mosaic was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book online!!!!! All bad”
Reviews.Author: shorty56150
Reviews.Content: We booked online and they had no rooms for two only a room for a single with two beds. When we arrived we were told it was another 50 euros! for the second person. The room was on sale for 119$USD. The hotel staff was friendly but that was obviously because they knew what was coming. They said talk with the manager and i did and he was rude, crude and downright ugly and expected the extra money. I didn't pay and went to another hotel and will fight my credit card charge. This is the 3rd time this has happened on this trip. the first two times I negotiated a fair deal. This is the latest scam so be aware. Just a word to the wise. This hotel is unfriendly and looking to take your money in an unfair way.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant with amazing views. Rooms are OK, not brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff
Reviews.Content: Regularly visit Istanbul. Was forced to stay here during a business trip when all the other hotels in the area got booked out. Happy to find that it is a lovely hotel and the view from the roof restaurant is the best in Istanbul by far. The quality of the restaurant food is superb. Best I've had in the city, and the prices are reasonable. Only issue is that there are not nearly enough waiting staff and I often had to go over to the kitchen during my visits to the restaurant to make my needs known. Hotels rooms are not big, but big enough to suffice. Bathrooms are a little too small to be comfortable, which is the only down-side to this hotel. Housekeeping staff are efficient and reliable. Although they only ever let you have one roll of toilet paper for some reason - unlike every other hotel here i experienced which leaves you several. No in-room kettle or tea/coffee making facilities whatsoever. A real shame and surprising considering all the other hotels here seem to offer this simple pleasure in the rooms. Also, they do not have irons and ironing boards - you have to use their professional laundry service instead. It's not expensive but kind of annoying that you can't just quickly iron a shirt when you have to rush off to a business meeting. Aircon seems a but temperamental and some days it worked fine, others it would remain off regardless of how much you tried to get it going. Minibar prices are not too bad. Location is great. Very close to Blue Mosque and i do mean VERY close. Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace are close by too. And it is practically next door to the Islamic Art Museum (aka Ibrahim Pasha Building). For those who have limited mobility though this place is definitely NOT for you. The lifts are small and cramped and they do not go to the top floor - you have to walk up a flight of stairs to the roof, which is a problem if you are disabled. The stairs also seem to be a little narrow. And worst of all you have to climb up and down a steep hill to get between the hotel and the nearby attractions. There is a spa, sauna, gym and Hammam in the basement. Never tried them but they look quite good, although the gym seems a little small.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location excellent hotel & value for money”
Reviews.Author: violet287
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and all attractions are within easy reach. We walked to the Bazaar and Spice Market and had lunch at one of the restaurants under the bridge. All are excellent and serve more or less the same menus. At the hotel breakfast is served on the 5th floor in the restaurant or you can sit outside on the terrace, both have great views over the Blue Mosque and surrounding buildings. Buffet breakfast was substantial and offered a good choice. There is also a bar on the terrace for that late evening drink. We had dinner in the restaurant one evening and the food was excellent and value for money. Although our room was on the small side, it was extremely clean. All the hotel staff were very polite and helpful. We took a taxi to the quay and booked a bosphorous trip which saved quite a lot on organised trips from the hotel.oice available. We also took a very pleasant boat trip across to Uskadar. This cost 1.5TL - you put the coins in the machine and obtain a token which is inserted into the entrance barrier. There are several Mosques and sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel shame about aircon”
Reviews.Author: easytraveller012
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for 3 nights in May and consider it a good hotel. A word of caution though, air conditioning (according to management) is not switched on until 15th May so that our stay on the 4th Floor until 12th May was rather warm. We specifically requested air conditioning when booking. We had to open windows wide and were awoken each morning at 4.50 by the calls to prayer from surrounding Mosques and the loud noise of refuse collection.

Reviews.Title: “I would return without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: Aneea
Reviews.Content: The views of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, from the rooftop restaurant, are to die for, and the proximity to the historical center can't be beat. The rooms are small, that's true, but I didn't go all the way to Istanbul to stay in the hotel! The air conditioning unit worked flawlessly, the rooms were tidy, the breakfast substantial, and the staff was friendly. If you're in Istanbul for the sights, and want a clean, safe place to stay, the location is great. No views from the rooms, but the rooftop more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but hotel is just acceptable”
Reviews.Author: anaidross
Reviews.Content: The location is great with an excellent view of the Blue Mosque on the 5th floor (where the restuarant is located). The hotel is really not beatable. You could walk to almost all of the major tourist attractions. But the hotel room is really small but clean and the breakfast is just ok. Overall, not a bad hotel considering the price paid and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: London2010june
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience at the next door hotel Pasha Ibriham, we checked into the lady Diana. The hotel has a very kitch loby area however the rooms are extremely clean, quiet and has brand new bathrooms. Breakfast was served upstrair on the rooftop overlooking the Blue mosque. They served a typical Turkish breakfast which filled one up nicely till lunch. I would highly recommend it, it was located within walking distance of all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for sightseen tour”
Reviews.Author: lounia
Reviews.Content: It's a good place for the first visit to Istanbul with the goal to take a look on Great Sofia and Blue Mosque. Superstar top-roof terrace with outstanding day and nigth view upon the hills of Istanbul. In the morning you'll get buffet-breakfast but in the evening prices can shock you - they appear to be more european than turkish. Some difficulties you meet when taking a taxi from a restaurant to the hotel - drivers often do not know where it is. Ask for a Blue Mosque and have a little walk - it's safe.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location, a great value hotel, with a priceless rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: admorph
Reviews.Content: From my travel blog ( http://www.travel.spinfirst.com ): Iâ€™ve picked a hotel with a perfect location and view, right in the center of Sultanahmet, the oldest part of the town. From the hotelâ€™s rooftop terrace is a perfect panorama over the incredible rooftops and minarets of the old city, reaching the shore of the sea of Maramara, which winds its way eventually to the Mediterranean. I can see the skyscrapers of modern Istanbul over on the other side of the Bosphorus River where cruise ships, ferries and cargo ships ply the waters from the Mediterranean to the Black Sea. My hotel (Lady Diana Hotel, Binbirdek, Sultanahmet) is a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle of the myriad streets (not to mention the hoardes of tourists). Itâ€™s quiet here, and while not a four or five star hotel, it is exactly what I needed. Particularly the roof terrace, itâ€™s my sanctuary above the city where each time I return Iâ€™ve gathered my thoughts and plans for the next outing. That pretty much sums it up. This is the cheapest hotel I stayed on a 9 country round the world trip, and it by far left the best memories because of its priceless rooftop deck. It is cheap, a great value, the restaurant is lack lustre, the hotel rooms are sparse, but it is good enough from which to enjoy the best of the sultanahmet quarter. try to get a room on the front side of the hotel, no real views except from the roof, but that's accessible 24/7 so you don't have to worry about it. The previous review warned about smells, but the whole area smells a bit, face it, the plumbing is hundreds of years old!! With windows open, no problems. it was good enough, clean enough and the rooftop made all the difference. Enjoy it. Or enjoy one of the dozen others at similar price in the neighborhood all with rooftop decks!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Lady Diana - thoroughly disappointing, do not be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Becca056
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Lady Diana hotel over the Easter bank holiday APR 2010 with my family - my two parents, and 19 year old sister. My parents had booked to stay in an 'suite' with my sister -as at the time of booking - the hotel had said they were unable to provide my sister and i with a room, and my parents with another. On arrival, this suite was actually just a 'normal' room, with three incredibly low, small, camp beds lined up. It was impossible to move. The bathroom was also no larger than a toilet on a plane, and it was so small that you were unable to sit on the loo, unless you sat to the side. My room was no better, what was a small double room, had merely had a bed removed and had no external windows. It was dark, with no ventilation and the air con (one of the named 'perks' of the hotel) was broken. Most importanly however, was the hideous stench of raw sewage. It was so pungent i actually couldnt stand in the room while they moved my luggage in. The hotel's response was first to shrug, and then only when my father (they seemed to only listen to men, not 'ladies' as they called us) went down, did the send someone up with an airfresher. We were told i could only move rooms the next day, and the manner in which they treated my complaint was appalling. I cannot express how unhygienic and unpleasant the smell was. The following day i was moved to another room, which still smelt the same. This time, the room had an external window, so the response again was to liberally spray the airfreshener (an intensely chemical smell) and leave the windows open (without any thought of the security threat this posed). i should also mention that none of the safety desposit boxes worked. The breakfasts were very, very disappoitning. Served in an incredbly bright terrace - the 'cooked' options of eggs and sausages were unrecognisable and the 'pastries' were stale and doughy. Not a 4 star breakfast in anyway. We booked the hotel based on reviews - but i would urge anyone booking to look elsewhere. this is not anywhere near a 4* hotel - and the talks of 'views of the blue mosque' is incredibly far fetched..unless you can se through buildings. Do not be fooled, book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Di-Gri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good: rooms, food and place. The view from the restaurant is beautiful. But the personnel was not helpful. We were asked to pay in advance not at check-out. Also we wanted to prolong the stay but the price suddenly increased. We wasn't able to sauna facility as it was busy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Improve your Fitnes Center!”
Reviews.Author: IlariHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Thank you - it was again nice to stay with you! Your Turkish bath is also enjoyable! Some of your Fitness Center equipment are quite obsolete or not even functioning! As there is a very limited space you should at least have suitable equipment - the investment for basic 4-5 pieces ofequipment should not be too high! With best regards, Ilari Rantakari

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DK-Desi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lady Diana in april 2009. Had a very good stay, eventhough the hotel seems to be larger on their website then it is. That did not bother much though. The hotel is clean and nice. Staff is helpfull and the rooms are small in size but well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Lady Diana Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: lionelp
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location. Staff is polite, price is correct. I recommend this hotel for short stay in Istanbul. View from the restaurant is incredible !

Reviews.Title: “"A VIEW TO KILL" Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: CalleOchoGroup
Reviews.Content: The Lady Diana is a total surprise to everyone that has had the pleasure of staying there. From the check in to the roof top restaurant that is like therapy at its best i highly reccommend this property. Location excellent. Serivce extremely friendly and attentive. It was a pleasure to have stayed there. Dont miss out on it. AA/Calle Ocho Travel Group Eddie Garcia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wlslb
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, this location is excellent - I went everywhere from this hotel. This city is very friendly and perfect for the diy traveler. The hotel is in a safe location (sometimes I went shopping without my husband and still felt really safe). It's tucked away from the busy streets but still steps away. The buffet breakfast was very good too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, great Staff”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in Lady Diana were not enough to explore the city so I may have to return. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel. Great value, very clean and the staff are very polite. The room was small but decent and squeaky clean. Breakfast is great, the restaurant on the top has a great view. Located near major landmarks. Definitely recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good view from upper-floor and 5* location!!!”
Reviews.Author: RussGuy
Reviews.Content: Its very clean, modern hotel in the center of historical Sultanahmet. We have been at the conference with my collegues and we happy that stay in Lady Diana not in Movenpick as other people who come for conference. Cose Lady Diana is at the center...everything is near....not far from the hotel great resautrane Boukoleon with fantastic view to Bosfor...we found it on small Istanbul street during our working in Sultanahmet...but we really suprised (cheep price - great service and food). Rooms are small but clean. location - 5*! Really, and staff was also very good! Breakfast was included and was really tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mgagnon66
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in during our visit to Turkey, and it was a nice start to the trip. The location is close to many of the sights, and the staff is very helpful. They helped us to make reservations and get directions to various restaurants we wanted to visit during our stay. The view of the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia are both beautiful from the rooftop restaurant. We stayed on the street side, and though we were nervous about the noise we were pleasantly surprised with quiet nights. Also-they had free internet access inthe Lobby which was not always available in other hotels-or available at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: welcomebb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and it was great. The restaurant on the roof has an amazing view over the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daidragon
Reviews.Content: An extremely nice hotel beautifully clean with many adavntages , Sauna, turkish bath, fitness suite and it has very helpful and polite staff. The Top Floor restaurant has incredible views over the City and the food was superb. The location is could ,nt be better, being within a few minutes walk of all the important sites in Istanbul . A Hotel I would recommend and will visit again. Certainly far better then many others I saw in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Recommandable”
Reviews.Author: kikecito
Reviews.Content: The only thing that bothered was that a certain bad smelling air entered into the room sometimes (probably through the air condition). The administration told that they were aware of this problem and that they were trying to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Lady Daiana Hotel - Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ZHatim
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed every aspect of my stay. The price was very good for the services I got. The view from the rooftop restaurant is spectacular. The service was wonderful. Thank you to all the staff. Hatim

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CyberAynne
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels and regardless of the negative reviews seen here, YOU WILL LOVE THIS HOTEL. In addition to its fabulous location & good food--you will not mind your small room when you have your first breakfast on the rooftop and soak up the magnificent views! Hagia Sofya, Blue Mosque, & Bosphorus strait will greet & delight you each morning. In the evening, end your day with their wonderful Efes beer and a plate of hummus back on the rooftop where the mosques are fully lit and make for a perfect ending to your day. Bathrooms have nice water pressure for showers but are very small--I recommend bringing a hanging toiletry bag as there is limited shelf space. This hotel also has its own Turkish Bath (hamman) and I found the Foaming Turkish Bath (without the scrubbing) to be absolutely sublime! Also, free internet in lobby made it easy to check in at home...And you can walk to almost everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star - rooftop terrace is the only good thing about it”
Reviews.Author: vavs
Reviews.Content: Expecting a four star hotel I was severly disappointed with the Lady Diana Hotel. Decor in the rooms was some of the ugliest I have seen, it felt like a 3 star budget hotel but is priced like a 4 star. Bathrooms are miniscule with a shower in a half-sized bathtub. Suites were bigger but equally as ugly. I am sure there are far better options for the same money. When we first arrived having booked a superior double we were put in the smallest hotel room I have ever seen (and we travel a lot!!) with only enough room for one person to shuffle round the bed and nowhere to put your bags - we were moved after complaining but overall the experience at the hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “The only downside to our holiday was this so called "4*" hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yoosa
Reviews.Content: The wife and I booked a room for two with a double bed - upon arrival we were shown a tiny room with two single beds! we went down to reception to say there must be some mistake but were told by the very unhelpful receptionist (Ali Rezza) that all other rooms are booked and that they'll move us tomorrow!! The rooms in this hotel are fairly tacky and bathrooms not maintained! the drain in the bath-tub was blocked and caused the water to rise! when they came with a plunger all sorts of filth seemed to be blocking the drain! the mildew build up and tiles that have turned yellow made us cringe!! the shower curtains were also falling apart and had turned a nasty yellow colour. The breakfast was also poor - nothing breakfast about it!! The only positive things I can say about this hotel is 1) the location was great and in the heart of the old city - within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace 2) the view from the balcony was a sight to behold - a shame the same couldn't be said about the inside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: montvert
Reviews.Content: I had made the hotel bookings online after I scanned a few hotels. I had chosen this hotel because it was ideally located. When I reached the hotel I was a little disappointed with the size of the room. But later I came to know that since the Hotel was very close to most of the Historical monuments, there is not much space to build a big hotel with big rooms.So I compromised on that. I was very happy with the location since it was just 2 minutes walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque and the Topkapi Palace. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and the breakfast was also good. We had a wonderful stay in Lady Diana Hotel

Reviews.Title: “What an unbelievable hassle”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: Very weird experience. Reserved a king size bed. Arrived. Shown a room with two beds. Unacceptable. Shown a smallish room with a bed and a view of a wall. Advised that this was nonsense and ruined our trip, oh... no... problem, how about a suite? Big, clean, unspeakably tacky. Truly a very nice breakfast room overlooking Old Town. Good breakfast. But, surely life doesn't have to be such a misery on check-in. Overall, just can't find the heart to recommend them. Rest is for rest, not for unarmed combat with reception. Too much hassle.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1212_9
Reviews.Content: I had the priveledge of staying at this hotel in July 2009 with my 16 yr old daughter. We had no idea what to expect but what we found was a hotel that was just perect for the two of us. The staff was extremely helpful and arranged our tour of Ephesus. It is located in the heart of the Old City and close to all major historical sites. The breakfast was an absolute treat and overlooked The Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. I noticed that other reviewers complained about the room size. I am not sure what else one would expect in Europe. We loved our room and bathroom. We didn't have a great view but that wasn't important to us. The AC worked really well. The beds were comfortable and the shower was the largest that we had seen on our 2 week trip. Free WiFi was available in all of the rooms which was an important feature for us as we had our own computer. There was also a computer available in the lobby. This hotel is a good value for the money. If I am ever in Istanbul again I will definitely stay at The Lady Diana again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the hotel itself is nice, the room we had was pretty bad.”
Reviews.Author: GeeQue
Reviews.Content: If location is your priority, then by all means stay at this hotel. However, don't expect a nice room. Ours was so small you could not even lay a suitcase open. No view, dark and dingy. Also, be prepared for them to tell you they have to move you to their "sister" hotel. I had heard they do this and it happened to us. When our friends arrived they were told the hotel was overbooked and were moved to a slightly lesser quality hotel. We were told there was a problem with the AC. I, however, did not buy their story and insisted we stay. They checked us in, but gave us a pretty lousy room.

Reviews.Title: “Handy spot, serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesTauranga
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, clean and tidy and probably the best you will find in the area, This is the area to stay as handy to most of the main attractions and in walking distance. If you want the nice 5 star resorts they are all over on the other side of town and just not handy. That's the sort of places we usually stay so we are a bit bias with 3 or 4 star accom. You spend little time in your room as there is so much to see in the area. Rooms are smallish but not to bad, Ask for a quite room, we got a corner room and got no noise, Aircon was ok, not to noisey. You have to keep windows closed at night as the mosques make quite a lot of noise every 4 hours or so. Take ear plugs, really helps. Don't rely on the reasturant, meals as they are pretty basic and after one main it's time to look elsewhere. I dont think the chef has a clue quite frankly. All the staff stand around gauking at you while eatiing, quite off putting. Use the resturant and outside decks for your coffees, nice setting and views. I'd stay here again as there is no choice but if there was a Sheraton etc next door you would'nt see me for dust. Ps they will also pick you up at airport for no cost. Good for peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo56
Reviews.Content: Location close to Blu Mosque and the old part of the city. Fantastic view from the resteurant deck. Great hospitality. Room was not large enough but for 3 days it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Maryuk
Reviews.Content: The Ladfy Diana Hotel was a good base for our trip to Istanbul.The location is excellent for Sultanahmet and the staff were very helpful with any requests . The rooms are fine but we would have welcomed either a sofa or a couple of armchairs in the room as after a day of sightseeing it would be nice to be able to sit somewhere other than on the bed. Also we could not understand why the fridge seting was so low - we put our water in there and it never got colder than room temperature - very strange. However these are minor issues and I can't write about this Hotel without mentioning the fabulous roof terrace & restaurant! The views of the Blue Mosque & Aya Sofia are just amazing and the buffet breakfast is marvellous with a huge amount of choices to suit everyone. One last thing - the free internet available in the lobby was invaluable for checking in for our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice rooms, Spa wonderful, Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: terrasurveyor
Reviews.Content: A slight mix up in the reservation and the hotel the hotel bent over backwards to make ammens - they put us in a junior suite. The suite was perfect for relaxing with my husband I had not seen for several months. I had ordered fruit, wine, and roses and they were in the room waiting. The staff was professional and helpful, although sometimes a little busy. The hotel was only 2 blocks from the lightrail stop and very accessible to all of the monuments. The views from the restaurant and patio are fantastic, the continental breakfast more than adequate. The best thing about the hotel was the location. You can walk to everything from here, and we did: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, and the ferry. The Blue Mosque is only a few blocks away, but heads up, walking 5-10 miles per day is my norm so not everyone will think a walk to the ferry as close. The turkish bath is a must do. My husband and I went down together and found it the perfect way to relax during our trip. I have recommended this hotel to several friends who were going to Istanbul and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sneck53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lady Diana for several days during our trip to Turkey. The hotel staff was very pleasant and accomodating. The hotel room was clean and nicely decorated (standard european size). The bathtub was incredibly small - a stand-up shower would have been a better idea, but overall the room was adequate for our needs. The breakfast was amazing, as was the view from the breakfast room. The hotel is situated close to Hagia Sophia and the blue mosque. There is a lot of shopping nearby, including an open air fruit/vegetable market. The tram line was within a few minutes walk. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the room was tiny”
Reviews.Author: KevinStevensTehran
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Istanbul. The location couldn't have been better. The view from the rooftop was amazing! The breakfast was average but not bad. Our room was very small. There wasn't even space to put our bags and the cupboards were too small unpack our clothes. When I asked to upgrade the room to a larger one, the receptionist ignored me. I was even prepared to pay extra to get a larger room although it seems there were no larger rooms available. The gym was tiny and very hot with no fan or aircon. I couldn't workout for more than 30 min. Not surprisingly it seemed like I was the only one that used the gym during our stay. They allowed us to use the internet for free but the settings were in Turkish which was quite irritating. Overall, the standard was not as good as other 4 star hotels I've stayed in (in other cities) but it seems like the norm for Sultanahmet as most hotels in this area have very small rooms and unfriendly staff at reception. I would recommend the hotel for people who are looking for a good location but if you want a spacious room then you should look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Normal”
Reviews.Author: MoscowMamasha
Reviews.Content: The Personal must learn russian language and be more mobile

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Lady Diana”
Reviews.Author: shmm77
Reviews.Content: Quit good and elegant hotel, very close to the most important hestroic places, they have free parking for the hotel witch it's important thing in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RichardN_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite nice. Definitely don't miss the Turkish bath. Walk to just about anywhere of interest in the old city. Service was friendly. We only ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, otherwise preferring to enjoy the gastronomic adventures Istanbul offers. The breakfast itself was adequate, but nothing to write home about. One drawback: The hotel charges for airport transfers are steep. Unless you stay several nights, you will pay 25 Euros each way. It's worth it on the inbound trip if it's your first time in Istanbul. Unless you have a really early departing flight, it's much cheaper to make an arrangement with a local taxi driver. Even after spending 8 nights in the hotel on our first visit, they would not do a complimentary transfer when I returned for a quick pass-through on business. I stayed somewhere else the second time and took care of the airport transfers myself.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: livelife95
Reviews.Content: very beautiful hotel with friendly & helpful staffs. despite the room's price is a bit on the high side & the room that we got was really small (even for just the 2 of us), everything else made up for the small room, i supposed if we're to ask for a bigger room, we'd have been given but we didn't, so, it was OK...and the breakfast was also not too bad. The best part was that the hotel is near to almost all of the major attractions in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_UKNatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lady Diana for 6 nights at the end of April. The location of the Lady Diana Hotel cannot be faulted! The bedrooms were small with very small en suites but they were perfectly adequate to sleep and freshen up in. The staff were very helpful and polite. The foyer and restaurant were spotlessly clean along with the bedding in the rooms but the bathrooms could have been cleaned better (it is a four star hotel!) with mildew beginning to grow along the sealant and behind the bathroom door not being vacuumed. The view from the terrace was also superb and was a very enjoyable start to each day with the okay breakfast. Breakfast was typically Turkish as most would expect with bread, jams, continental cheeses, fruit salad, yogurt and some form of scrambled egg, very hard boiled eggs and passable cereals. Overall we had a very satisfactory and enjoyable stay at the hotel. The main complaint about the hotel was value for money but we must say that it is very difficult to find value for money anywhere in the Sultanahmet so this hotel is about the right price for its standard in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, great roof top restaurant view, good service, 4*? G.G.L. U.K.”
Reviews.Author: GLTN
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished hotel in a good location near the Blue Mosque etc. and the excellent tram service that gets you everywhere, also easy to walk to many places of interest. There was a good and large choice for the buffet breakfast in the roof top restaurant with a pleasant outside terrace and spectaculer sea and city views. Good service with a pleasant customer service "manager" called Yasmin. The rooms however were very small as were the ensuite facilities but they were clean, linen was changed and the room cleaned each morning, soaps etc. were not sufficient. Not really a four star hotel to be honest but really quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Roof Top Restuarant”
Reviews.Author: abdul63
Reviews.Content: We stayed five night at this hotel. First night we were upgraded to the so called suite room. This room has funny decor with ugly yellow canaopy and bed, dirty carpet, nude pictures, and cheap toiletries. This equivalent to a motel 6 room in USA. The ugly nude pictures will only suit a young honey moon couple. For the next four nights we were give a double room with two single beds, filthy carpet, tiny bathroom, a desk, a stool, and nothing else. On our request they put the two single beds together but it was still uncomfortable with two separate quilts and gap in the middle. The so called bath tub was so tiny that you could barely stand in it. No way you can have a bath. The wash basin was so tiny you could only put a couple of tooth brushes only. The room did not have a palce to sit. You can sit on the bed. Perhaps they encourage you to be out sighseeing all the time and come back to sleep. As a minimum, they can spend $100.00 per room to replace carpets in the tiny rooms. They can afford it with room charges more than $130.00 minimum. The hotel offers free buffet breakfast at the roof top resturant which has great view of Blue mosque, Sofia Museum and Istanbul Straits. Variety of food available. The hotel staff speaks good English and helpful. However, they try to sell you expensive tour packages which are not necessary. You can have a 6 hour cruise of Istabul straits for about $12.00. The guided tour costs about $80.00. Bottom line is the hotel is similar to all other hotels in Sultanahmet area and about same prices. If you want a modern hotel, stay in Taksim area and take 20 minute ride in metro. It only costs one dollar per ride..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but disappointing standard; not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Silkman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a deluxe suite.Certainly not 4*; really cheap bathroom toiletries, cheap decorations and weird bed canopy! Restaurant very standard tourist fare aimed at tour groups. Can't fault the view from the roof or the attitude of the serving staff. Just disappointing overall. Look for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Eric168SaudiArabia
Reviews.Content: I had a nice & clean room facing the street although a bit noisy sometimes. The hotel service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful view and location”
Reviews.Author: chrisfromAustralia
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Istanbul. On the first trip we saw the Lady Diana hotel and it looked very nice. More importantly for us, it was very conveniently located close to Bosphoros and to main market areas. When we checked in we were totally amazed at the fantastic view from the dining room on the top floor. Very friendly staff and fantastic value for money. We stayed at end of February but it was still freezing outdoors so we really loved spending one afternoon in the turkish bath area. Will definitely go back Chris and Christine Picone

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and good quality service”
Reviews.Author: FranzUtrecht
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent christmas for me and my wife. I've booked the hotel from hotel website.I've booked for extra services as well,like sightseeing tours and roses&wine for my wife. They fetch us from airport.When we arrived to the hotel,they offered us welcome drinks at Top restaurant. There was an amazing view over there.The blue mosque ,hagia sophia and the sea...was really excellent. We had our brekfast on that restaurant durin our stay. Room was clean and comfortable.The size was ok.(Not so big) I really reccomend this hotel to everyone. Very good location and nice top restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Lady Diana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Terzihane Sokak 9 | Binbirdirek Mahallesi, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
